isilib A Python library for simplifying bibliometric research of Web of Science data

Installation

The download from Github includes a customized Vagrant file that installs isilib and other useful Python libraries into a virtual machine. It is currently the easiest way of getting isilib working if you are not already using Python. Alternatively you can run setup.py install to install locally

Please note that isilib is under active development and these instructions may be out of date.

Install with Vagrant

The vagrant method is intended for students and those not familiar with python it creates a virtual machine with isilib installed. It also contains the python scientific stack numpy, scipy and matplotlib as well a series of iPython notebooks for teaching people to use isilib and python.

Once vagrant and a hypervisor(virtualBox is the default) are installed, download isilib, click here to download it as a zip file. Go to the vagrant subdirectory and run vagrant up or if you are using OS X double click the file mac_run. This will initialize the virtual machine and install all the required software on it.

Now the virtual machine is hosting a iPython notebook on port 8888 you can access it by going to http://localhost:8888/ or if you used mac_run a window will appear at it. You can also use vagrant ssh to access the virtual machine.

Install without Vagrant

Installing without Vagrant is done with setuptools. Go to the isilib directory and run python3 setup.py install
